fields.text: Quais das seguintes afirmações são verdadeiras sobre os comandos "su" e "sudo"?
The "su-" command only switches the user identity to "root", but the shell environment remains that of the common user.
When the "su" command is used, both the user identity and shell environment are switched to the "root" user.
The "sudo" command allows common users to execute commands that only the "root" user can execute.
In openEuler, which of the following commands can be used to view network device configurations?
Which of the following statements are true about task management in openEuler?
Cron checks every minute for commands that need to be run, which consumes a lot of resources.
Cron is suitable for periodic execution of commands.
The "at" command must specify both the date and time.
The "at" command can specify a specific time for the system to run a script.
Which of the following statements are true about the openGauss import and export tools?
gs_dumpall needs to be executed by the root user, but gs_dump does not need to be executed.
Both gs_dump and gs_dumpall can export database object information.
gs_restore can import the files exported by gs_dump.
gs_dump can directly export the entire database and its data files.
Which of the following statements are true about the single-node database architecture?
The single-node architecture is not scalable and cannot cope with increasing service requirements.
If the single-node architecture is faulty, data loss may occur.
In the single-node architecture, applications may preempt database resources, which cannot be resolved.
The single-node architecture has performance bottlenecks.
In drive I/O subsystem tuning, which of the following options are key tuning strategies?
Which of the following statements are true about the usage of the COPY command in openGauss?
Export table data copy, table1 to ‘data/input/t1_output.txt’ delimiter ‘^’
Import text data, copy from ‘data/input/t1_output.txt’ delimiter ‘^’
Export table data copy to table1 from ‘data/inputt1_output.text’ delimiter ‘^’
Import text data copy values from “data/input/t1.txt delimiter
Which of the following commands can be used to collect OS and log information to locate faults when openGauss is faulty?
Which of the following are NOT characteristics of the sharednothing architecture?
Nodes are independent of each other, process their own data, and return their one result to applications.
Each processing unit has its own private memory, CPU and hard disk.
Which of the following system catalogs or views can be used to query table information in a database?
Which of the following statements is true about the fully encrypted equality capability of the openGauss database?
In openGauss, which of the following commands are used to insert new data into a table?
Which of the following statements are true about schemas in openGauss?
By default, each database has a schema named "public".
Database objects with the same name can exist in different schemas of the same database without causing conflicts
When a user is created, the system automatically creates a schema with the same name as the user.
Schemas help multiple users operate the same database without interference
Which of the following statements about periodic tasks is correct
the at command can be used to set periodic tasks
the job command can be used to set periodic tasks

In openGauss, the Sophon intelligent index optimization technology enables databases to adjust index policies based on workloads automatically. In this way, the query performance can be continuously optimized without manual intervention.

The cluster manager (CM) manages and monitors the running status of each functional unit and physical resource in the openGauss database system, executes SQL commands sent by client, and processes data storage and query tasks.
Which of the following statements are true about the openGauss import and export tools?
gs_dumpall needs to be executed by the root user, but gs_dump does not need to be executed
Both gs_dump and gs_dumpall can export database object information
gs_restore can import the files exported by gs_dump
gs_dump can directly export the entire database and its data files.
Which keywords or clauses are the main components of Data Query Language (DQL) in SQL?
The “commit” command is used to commit a transaction to a database
After the openGauss enterprise edition is installed, you can run the “gs_om -t start” command to start the database.
Which of the following statements is false?
A user is a set of roles
A role is a set of users
In openGauss, users and roles use the same operation and maintenance methods
When creating a user, you can specify the validity period of the user.
Compared with other open-source databases, openGauss has many new technical features. Which of the following statements is false?
It provides the Sstore engine for frequent query scenarios
It provides the Ustore for frequent update scenarios.
It adopts the Mulan Permissive Software License, allowing code to be freely modified, used, and referenced.
It provides Al-based parameter tuning and index recommendations and automatically recommends Al parameters.
Which of the following threads does not belong to openGauss?
Which of the following openGauss commands is used to create a schema?
Which of the following statements is true about the openGauss database architecture?
openGauss uses the single-process and multi-thread architecture. All database operations are performed in the same process as threads.
openGauss uses the multi-process architecture. Each database connection corresponds to an independent process.
openGauss uses the client/server architecture. The client and server run in the same process
open Gauss uses the multi-process and multi-thread architecture
Which of the following files is used to set the openGauss client authentication policy?
openGauss uses the thread pool model to implement high concurrency. What is the number of concurrent connections in the default configuration?
Which of the following statements is true about openGauss column-store tables?
The physical data file size of both column-store and row-store tables is 8192 bytes.
Each column in a column-store table corresponds to a physical data file.
Data in a column-store table is stored in a physical data file.
The default data compression level of column-store tables is high.
Which of the following components generates and maintains globally unique information such as global transaction, snapshots, timestamps and sequences

Assume that user A’s account has CNY100. At t1, user B transfers CNY200 to User A. At t2, User C transfers CNY300 to user A. User B terminates the transfer. At t4, User C, successfully completes the transfer. At t5, the banking system becomes faulty. (t1 < t2 < t3 < t4 < t5) after the banking system recovers, how much money will be in User A’s account?
Which of the following commands can be used to roll back the current transaction
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of the OpenGauss transaction
In OpenGauss, which of the following gsql meta-commands can list all database roles?
Which of the following SQL languages is used to set or change the database transactions, authorize operations, and lock tables?
In OpenGauss, which of the following SQL statements is used to modify column attributes
ALTER TABLE t SET col1 to nvarchar(20);
ALTER TABLE t rebuild col1 to col2;

The existing sequence seq1 in openGauss is defined as follows: CREATE SEQUENCE seq1 START WITH 8 MAXVALUE 11 INCREMENT BY 2 CYCLE;. Which of the following results is obtained after the SQL statement SELECT nextval(seq1) is executed for five times?
Which of the following statements is true about the fully-encrypted equality query capability of the OpenGauss database?
Data is encrypted during storage and decrypted using the dynamic key provided by the application during computing
Data is encrypted during storage and computing and decrypted when it is returned to the client
Data is encrypted during storage and decrypted during computing. Data is encrypted during transmission, storage and computing and cannot be decrypted
Data is encrypted during transmission, storage and computing and cannot be decrypted
Which of the following tools is used to check whether the environment meets the installation requirements before openGauss installation?
Which of the following statements is false about the ACID feature of database transactions?
I refers to availability. The database system must provide the highest availability for database execution to ensure that most transactions can be successfully executed
A refers to atomicity. Operations in a transaction are either successful or all failed
C refers to consistency. The system status can only be the status before the transaction or after the transaction is successful. No inconsistent status can occur
D refers to durability. The status of a successful transaction can be maintained even if the machine is powered off
Which of the following statements is true about the separation of duties of OpenGauss?
The responsibilities between databases instances, databases and tablespaces are separated
Database read, write, and management operations are performed by differents roles or users
Database administrators (DBAs) application developers and system administrators have the same permissions and responsibilities
The responsibilities of database management, data security, and database audit log viewing and management are assigned to different roles or
When you create or update a user account in OpenGauss, which of the following options can improve account security
Allowing any IP address to log in
Which of the following are the join operators of openGauss?
Which of the following options are equivalent to OFFSET 3 LIMIT 10?
Which of the following statements are true about the openGauss table design?
COMMENT does not need to be added
For Astores tables are frequently updated, a small fill factor needs to be specified
Planning the table structure design prevents the addition of columns and modification of column types or lengths
Clustering or partial clustering is used to implement continuous storage of hot data and convert random I/Os into continuous I/Os
Which of the following statements are true about openGauss database auxiliary thread?
WAL writer is responsible for writing permanent records of committed transactions to WAL files
Checkpointer is used to periodically check the points of flush dirty pages to disks to ensure database consistency
AutoVacuum is used to collect statistics on objects. SQL statements sessions, and looks and store the statistics in the pgstat.stat file
Page writer is used for copying the dirty page data to the doublewrite area and flushing the data to disks
In the openGauss fully-encrypted database, which of the following methods can be used to create an encrypted table?
Use the ALTER TABLE statement to specify the encryption algorithm and key.
Use the CREATE TABLE statement to specify the encryption algorithm and key
Use the CREATE TABLESPACE statement to specify the encryption algorithm and key
Run the pg_dump command to back up the existing encrypted table and specify the encryption algorithm and key
In openGauss the SMALLINT type occupies one byte:
Indexes can improve the data retrieval speed. In openGauss, an index takes effect only for one column. If an index is created for multiple columns, the index takes effect only for the first column:
If data in the base table changes, the data queried from the view changes accordingly:
You do not need to create an XML file before using the installation package to install openGauss.
In primary/standby deployment mode, all database nodes share the postgresql.conf configuration file:
Which of the following is a database connection tool provided by openGauss to run in the command line?
In the openGauss data types, how many bytes does the DATA type occupy?
Which of the following components uses shards and replicas of GausDB (for openGauss)?
Assume the customer table exists in the tpcds schema. Which of the following commands CANNOT be used to delete the tpcds schema?
drop table tpcds customer drop schema tpcds
In openGauss, which of the following technologies can eliminate single points of failure (SPOF) through multi-layer redundancy?
Which of the following is not a binary operator in openGauss?
Which of the following commands can be used to uninstall the openGauss database and delete the data directory?
Which of the following tools is used to help users understand the database workload of openGauss?
Which of the following statements is true about the logical replication of the openGauss database?
It supports primary-primary deployment and table-level replication, and converts binary logs to logical SQL statements
It supports primary-primary deployment and table-level replication
It converts binary logs to logical SQL statements and supports table-level replication
It supports primary-primary deployment and converts binary logs to logical SQL statements
Which of the following drivers is used by the client connection tool Data Studio to communicate with the openGauss database?
System catalogs store the structured metadata of openGauss. They are the source of information used by openGauss to control system running and are component of the database system.
When a large number of update or deletion operators are performed in the database, you can run the VACUUM statement to restore disk page fragments and return them to the OS
Column-store tables support updates with uncertain results. No error is reported when you attempt to update a row with multiple rows of data in a column-store table.
In openGauss, you must have the super administrator permission to create a schema (CREATE SCHEMA)
The operation result of the logical operator can be TRUE, FALSE or NULL. NULL indicates unknown.

DRS provides backup migration without exposing source databases. It is applicable to scenarios where you do not want to expose IP addresses to the public network. Which of the following is not a step in the backup migration process?
Use DRS to restore backup data from OBS to a target database.
Use DRS to connect source and target databases.
Upload the source database backup file to OBS
Export data from the source database as a backup file
In openGauss, which of the following technologies implements node scaling
Which of the following is false about the maximum values of the specifications in openGauss?
Number of columns in composite index: 64
Size of data in a single row: 1 GB
In openGauss, which of the following can be used to calculate the center of a rectangle?
In openGauss, which of the following is a default folder for WALs?
Which of the following system views can display information about database parameters at run time?
Which of the following is a character processing function in openGauss?
Qual das seguintes opções descreve corretamente o comportamento da criptografia de dados?
Data is encrypted during storage and decrypted using the dynamic key provided by the application during computing
Data is encrypted during transmission, storage and computing and cannot be decrypted
Data is encrypted during storage and computing and decrypted when it returned to the client
Data is encrypted during storage and decrypted during computing
Qual protocolo de código aberto o openGauss utiliza?

Os modelos de armazenamento por linha e por coluna têm suas próprias vantagens e desvantagens. Eles são geralmente usados para bancos de dados de processamento transacional. Por padrão, o modelo de armazenamento por coluna é utilizado.
No openGauss, quais das seguintes visões de sistema estão relacionadas à informação de auditoria?
Qual das seguintes instruções pode ser usada para excluir dados de uma tabela no openGauss?
Quais das seguintes afirmações são verdadeiras sobre o DRS?

DRS real time migration allows you to directly migrate data from the source database to the target database if they are connected, and if the sourcer database instances, target database instances, and migration objects are configured.

DRS real-time synchronization is different from real-time migration. Migration means moving your whole database from one platform to another. Synchronization refers to the continuous flow of data between different services. It applies to scenarios such as real-time analysis, report system, and data warehouse environment.
Using DRS backup migration, you can migrate data without exposing your source databases to the internet.
Data Replication Service (DRS) is a cloud service used for real-time database migration and synchronization
In the openGauss data types, how many bytes does the DATE type occupy?
In openGauss, system catalogs and all built-in data types, functions, and operators belong to which of the following schemas?
To prevent disclosure of user passwords, openGauss encrypts and stores them in which of the following system catalogs?
Which of the following statements about the second normal form (2NF) of the database is false?
If a composite primary key exists in a table, other non-primary key columns can partially depend on the column in the composite key
2NF is established on the basis of 1NF, that is, 1NF must be met before 2NF can be
2NF requires that each instance or row in a database table be uniquely distinguishable
Which of the following functions is provided by the CM module of a database cluster?
It manages and monitors the running status of functional units and physical resources in a distributed system, ensuring stable operation of the entire system.
It provides management interfaces and tools for routine maintenance and configuration management of the cluster
It generates and maintains globally unique information such as global transaction IDs, transaction snapshots, timestamps, and sequences.
It receives access requests from the application layer, and returns the execution result to the client. It breaks down tasks and distributes task fragments to different DNs for parallel processing.
Which of the following data types is aliased INT4?
An application can set appropriate parameters by calling gs_guc. Which of the following is the meaning of -N all?
client can connect to any database.
Statements that need to be added in the pg_hba.conf file.
Which of the following statements about the deployment modes supported by openGauss is true?
Both standalone deployment and primary/standby deployment are supported.
Write-ahead logs (WALs) are important in the openGauss database and may be used for operation restoration when the system crashes. Which of the following is the default folder for WALs?
Which of the following keywords indicates that a data source cannot be deleted as objects that depend on it currently exist?
After separation of duties in GaussDB (for openGauss) is enabled, which of the following administrators can view audit logs?
Which of the following type conversion functions is used to convert x to the type specified by y?

Anomaly_detection is a tool integrated into openGauss and can be used to collect and predict database indicators, as well as monitor and diagnose exceptions. Which of the following statements about anomaly_detection is false?
Anomaly_detection can monitor multiple indicators at the same time and predict the trends for each indicator.
Anomaly_detection consists of an agent and a detector.
The agent module of anomaly_detection and the openGauss database can be deployed on different servers.
The detector module of anomaly_detection communicates with the agent module over HTTP or HTTPS.
Which of the following tools can be used to start or stop openGauss and generate or update the configuration file?
One-click diagnosis information collection helps administrators quickly obtain collected information. Which of the following statements about one-click diagnosis information collection is false?
It provides multiple suites to capture, collect, and analyze diagnosis data, enabling fault diagnosis and accelerating the diagnosis process.

It extracts necessary database logs, cluster management logs, and stack information from the environment based on the requirements of development and fault locating personnel. Administrators demarcate and locate faults based on the obtained information.
The one-click collection tool obtains different information from the production environment depending on the actual faults, improving the fault locating and demarcation efficiency.
Administrators can collect the required information without modifying the configuration file.
Which of the following geometry types supported by openGauss represents a rectangle?
Which of the following statements about the validity period of a user account is false?
The validity period of a user account is set to limit the operation period of the user.
new validity period is set to enable a user not within the validity period to use its account.
An operation period includes the validity start time and validity end time.
If the start and end times of the validity period are not specified, the default validity period is used.
Which of the following commands cannot be used to view user information?
By default, all users and roles in openGauss have which of the following permissions?
Compared with the column-store model, which of the following are advantages of the row-store model?
Only the selected columns are read.
Which of the following statements about the openGauss feature of binding threads to cores based on NUMA are true?
This feature is used to avoid the switchover time of corresponding threads on different CPU cores.
This feature reduces resource contention for corresponding threads.
If this feature is not used, the corresponding thread queue waits for a time slice to be allocated.
Threads are bound to cores to avoid thread offset between cores.
Which of the following operations on tables are DDL operations?
openGauss supports database audit. Which of the following system views are related to audit information?
Which of the following are common logical operators?
Which of the following capabilities belong to DB4AI of the openGauss database?
Which of the following statements are true about the features of the real-time migration function in DRS?
Only table data can be migrated.
During migration, it allows services to continue to be used externally as much as possible.
It effectively minimizes the impact on services.
It is used to smoothly migrate databases to the cloud.
Which types of network addresses can be stored among the data types provided by openGauss?
MOT supports a complete set of database features, such as stored procedures and user-defined functions.
MOT supports a complete set of database features, such as stored procedures and user-defined functions.
MOT does not support stored procedures.
MOT supports only basic SQL queries.
MOT lacks support for user-defined functions.
MOT fully supports ACID features and includes strict persistence and high availability support.
MOT oferece suporte parcial a recursos ACID.
MOT oferece suporte completo a recursos ACID, incluindo persistência rigorosa e alta disponibilidade.
MOT ignora a persistência de dados.
MOT’s near-lock-free design and highly tuned implementation enable superior near-linear throughput scaling on multi-core servers.
MOT não é otimizado para servidores multi-core.
MOT depende fortemente de bloqueios para escalabilidade.
O design quase livre de bloqueios do MOT permite escalabilidade quase linear em servidores multi-core.
MOT não oferece escalabilidade em throughput.
Administrators use gs_dumpall to export data. Which of the following statements about the gs_dumpall command are true?
gs_dumpall is executed by the OS user omm.
Other users cannot access the openGauss database when gs_dumpall is used to export data.
During an export, gs_dumpall reads all the tables in a database, so you need to connect to the database as an openGauss administrator to export a complete file.
The result exported from gs_dumpall is an SQL script file in plain text format.
Which of the following are common database management systems?
Which of the following SQL statements return an output result of “03:00:00”?
SELECT time ‘05:00’ - interval ‘2 minutes’ AS RESULT;
SELECT time ‘05:00’ - interval ‘2 hours’ AS RESULT;
SELECT time ‘04:00’ - interval ‘1 minutes’ AS RESULT;
SELECT time ‘04:00’ - interval ‘1 hours’ AS RESULT;
Which of the following are part of the three-layer key management mechanism in the openGauss fully-encrypted equality query process?
Which of the following statements about tablespaces controlling the layout of database disks are true?
Tablespaces can be used to arrange storage locations for database objects as needed, improving database performance.
When a partition is shared with other data, tablespaces will not occupy excessive space in the partition.
Tablespaces são usados apenas para backup.
Tablespaces não afetam o desempenho do banco de dados.
When the usage of the disk where tablespace resides reaches 60%, the tablespace can set the database to read-only mode.
The database automatically switches to read-only mode when disk usage reaches 60%.
Tablespaces can be moved to another disk when usage reaches 60%.
The database remains in read-write mode regardless of disk usage.
The database can be set to read-only mode when disk usage reaches a certain threshold.

If the disk partition or volume allocated to the initialized database is full and the space cannot be logically increased, you can create and use tablespaces in other partitions until the space is reconfigured.
The database must be deleted and reinitialized if the disk is full.
Tablespaces cannot be created in other partitions.
You can create and use tablespaces in other partitions until space is reconfigured.
The database automatically expands the current partition.
Service data flows in a fully-encrypted database exist in ciphertext form during data processing. Which of the following statements about equality query in a fully-encrypted database are true?
The fully-encrypted database protects data privacy and security throughout the lifecycle on the cloud.
Attackers cannot obtain valid information from the database server regardless of the data status.
Users can keep keys for themselves, preventing high-privilege users from obtaining valid data information.
The fully-encrypted database enables cloud databases to better comply with personal privacy protection laws and regulations.
Data is stored in ciphertext and therefore does not need to be protected by firewalls.
Which of the following statements about system catalogs and system views are true?
System catalogs store openGauss structural metadata. They are the source of information used by openGauss to control system operations.
The system view provides methods to query system catalogs and the internal state of the database.
System catalogs and views are visible only to administrators.
In normal cases, users should not manually modify system catalogs or views.

The accuracy of the statistics may affect the database’s ability to generate a valid execution plan. Which of the following describes situations in which you should consider recollecting statistics to ensure they are accurate?
After a large amount of data is inserted, updated, or deleted.
After structural changes to tables or indexes.
Numerous inserts or deletes are performed on a table.
The intermediate table is generated in the batch processing script or stored procedure.
If multiple columns in a table are related to each other and the query has conditions or grouping operations based on those columns, you can attempt to collect multi-column statistics.
Numerous update operations are performed on a table.
Which of the following statements about hash distribution are true?
It applies to user tables with a small amount of data.
It calculates the hash value of a single or multiple distribution columns specified by users.
Data from the same user table is stored in different shards.
It increases the total amount of data supported by the database.
Which of the following functions can be implemented by the system administrator by restricting the permission to execute a stored procedure?
Restrict access to all data in the database.
Prevent unauthorized users from accessing data.

Database security administrators can use audit logs to reproduce a series of events that caused a fault in the database or to identify unauthorized users, unauthorized operations, and the time when these operations were performed.
In the logical structure of a database, one tablespace can correspond to multiple databases.
Developed based on the Kunpeng ecosystem, GaussDB(for openGauss) continuously optimizes its performance to meet ever-increasing demands across a wide range of scenarios.
openGauss does not support CBO. The optimization capability in complex scenarios is average.
With GaussDB(for openGauss) parallel data import, the system can quickly import external data of a specific format (CSV/TEXT/FIXED) to databases.
In standalone mode, multiple database instances are deployed on a single host for data security purposes.

openGauss is a relational database. It uses a client/server, single-process multi-thread architecture and supports standalone and one-primary multi-standby deployment. When primary/standby deployment is used, the standby node can be read too, and HA and read expansion are supported.
You are not allowed to rename a database in use. To rename it, connect to another database.
A hint specified for a query plan does not apply to its subquery plans. To specify a hint for a subquery, add the hint following the SELECT of this subquery.
RTO refers to the maximum amount of data loss that can be tolerated, that is, the time point corresponding to the data after service recovery.
If the disk partition or volume allocated to the initialized database is full, you can create and use tablespaces in other partitions until the space is reconfigured.
Bit strings are strings of 1’s and 0’s. The bit type data must match the length n. An error is reported if short or long data is stored.
A transaction is a logical unit of program execution, consisting of a series of operators for accessing or updating data in the system.
Currently, a SERIAL column can be specified when you create a table and can be inserted in an existing table.
You can set multiple IP addresses for each of the backIp, sshIp, and listenIp parameters in a configuration file.
PG_STATS displays the single-column statistics stored in the PG_STATISTIC table.
GaussDB(for openGauss) provides logical backup capabilities, but can only back up data in user tables to local disk files and OBS in text format.
Standalone deployment is special. There is only one data copy. Once data is damaged or lost, only physical backups can be used to restore data.
If the time format of another database is different to that of openGauss, you can change the value of () to ensure consistency.

A company uses the openGauss primary/standby deployment mode to deploy the system. When the primary database is abnormal, the administrator uses () to promote the standby database to the primary database to continue supporting services.
If you specify the () parameter when running the CREATE TABLE statement, data in the table will be partitioned.
In SQL statements, the common logical operators are AND, OR and ().
In the MOT statement for creating or deleting a memory-optimized table, the () keyword can be used to reference the MOT.
Which of the following is not a component of a database system?
Which of the following statements about the ACID feature of database transactions is incorrect?
A indicates atomicity, whereby operations in a transaction are either all successful or all failed.
C refers to consistency, whereby the system status can only be the status before the transaction or after the transaction is successful. No inconsistent intermediate status can occur.

I refers to availability, whereby the database system must provide the highest availability possible for transaction execution in order to ensure as many successfully executed transactions as possible.
D refers to durability, whereby the status of a successful transaction can be maintained, even if the machine is powered off.
Which of the following phases are involved in the development of data management technologies?
Which of the following is not an openGauss server tool?
When the gs_checkperf tool is used to check system performance, which of the following can be viewed only by user root?
Which of the following are the openGauss deployment modes?
One primary and multiple standbys deployment
Users and roles have the same syntax in the openGauss database. Therefore, they are fully equivalent.
Which of the following commands can be used to export partial data from the student table?
Which of the following statements about row-store tables and column-store tables are true?
Row-store tables are used in scenarios where INSERT and UPDATE operations are frequently performed.
Row-store tables are applicable to point queries, that is, simple index-based queries that return a small number of records.
CLOB is used to store large object data of the TEXT type.
Which of the following logical expressions is used to search for records whose position is an engineer and salary is greater than 6000?
In a WHERE clause, the expression "age between 20 and 30" is equivalent to.

Assume that you want to query student names, ages, and scores from the student table, and want the results sorted in descending order by age. If there are students of the same age, they are sorted in ascending order by score instead. Which of the following SQL statements can be used?
SELECT name, age, score FROM student order by age desc, score;
SELECT name, age, score FROM student order by age, score asc;
SELECT name, age, score FROM student order by 2 desc, 3 asc;
SELECT name, age, score FROM student order by 1 desc, 2;
Which of the following SQL commands can be used to increase the value of the AGE column in the STAFFS table by five years?
Which of the following four groups of SQL commands belong to the DML commands?
Qual das seguintes instruções SQL está correta para excluir registros da tabela student onde cid = 6?
When an index is created for a table, the corresponding base table is deleted if the index is canceled.
SQL integrates data query, data manipulation, data definition, and data control. Which of the following functions is implemented by the CREATE, DROP, and ALTER statements?

Create a decremental sequence named seq_1. The starting value is 400, the step is –4, and the minimum value is 100. When the sequence reaches the minimum value, it can be cyclically executed. Which of the following statements are correct?
CREATE SEQUENCE seq_1 START WITH 400 MAXVALUE 100 INCREMENT BY -4 CYCLE;
CREATE SEQUENCE seq_1 MAXVALUE 400 MINVALUE 100 INCREMENT BY -4 CYCLE;
CREATE SEQUENCE seq_1 START WITH 400 MINVALUE 100 INCREMENT BY -4 CYCLE;
CREATE SEQUENCE seq_1 START WITH 400 MINVALUE 100 MAXVALUE 400 INCREMENT BY -4 CYCLE;
What is the result returned by the SQL statement SELECT date '2021-4-28' + integer '7' AS RESULT;?
Which of the following are arithmetic functions?
Which of the following are logical operators?
Which three separate approaches to pattern matching are provided by a database?
In the GaussDB distributed architecture, which of the following components is used for sharing configuration and service discovery (service registration and search)?
Quais das seguintes afirmações sobre o processador Kunpeng 920 são verdadeiras?
O conjunto de instruções do processador Kunpeng 920 é compatível com ARMv8.2, com frequência máxima de operação de 2,6 GHz e estrutura de cache multinível.
O processador Kunpeng 920 pode integrar até 64 núcleos desenvolvidos internamente e suporta múltiplas configurações de núcleos, como 64, 48 e 32 núcleos.
O processador Kunpeng 920 oferece suporte a interfaces de E/S, incluindo controladoras PCIe, SAS/SATA 3.0 e interfaces de rede de alta velocidade como 2 × 100G RoCE e diversos padrões Ethernet.
O processador Kunpeng 920 é compatível apenas com sistemas operacionais baseados em Windows.
O processador Kunpeng 920 utiliza exclusivamente núcleos licenciados de terceiros.
Quais das seguintes afirmações são verdadeiras sobre o sistema operacional openEuler?
openEuler não suporta implantação de aplicações em contêineres e é voltado principalmente para ambientes de virtualização tradicionais.
openEuler fornece capacidades de auto-otimização do kernel, que podem ajustar automaticamente o desempenho do sistema com base nos cenários de aplicação.
Uma versão comunitária com suporte de longo prazo (LTS) é lançada a cada dois anos.
openEuler oferece suporte apenas às arquiteturas x86 e MIPS.
Quais das seguintes afirmações são verdadeiras sobre métodos comuns de teste de desempenho?

Teste de confiabilidade consiste em aplicar uma certa carga de serviço e executar continuamente por um período para verificar se o sistema pode operar de forma estável, focando na capacidade de pressão instantânea do sistema.
Teste de benchmark é realizado para testar quantitativa e comparativamente uma métrica de desempenho de um objeto de teste, por meio de métodos científicos, ferramentas e sistemas de teste.
Teste de carga mede a capacidade de um sistema aumentando continuamente a carga até que ocorra gargalo de desempenho ou saturação de recursos.
Teste de estresse avalia a capacidade de processamento do sistema em estado saturado, geralmente com uso elevado de CPU e memória, para testar a estabilidade do sistema.
Os recursos e serviços oferecidos pela comunidade Kunpeng são limitados ao suporte em nível de software e não se estendem ao suporte técnico em nível de hardware.
PXE booting ou unidades de CD-ROM virtuais são métodos comuns para instalação em lote do openEuler.
O comando "ls -a" exibe todos os arquivos e diretórios, incluindo os ocultos que começam com um ponto.
Para definir repositórios personalizados de fontes de software, é possível adicionar entradas "repository" no arquivo "/etc/dnf/dnf.conf" ou criar arquivos .repo no diretório "/etc/yum.repos.d/".
Tarefas agendadas com cron geralmente incluem ">/dev/null 2>&1" ao final.
A virtualização é uma técnica de gerenciamento de recursos que abstrai e transforma recursos físicos como processadores, memória, armazenamento e NICs.
No openEuler, o comando “at” pode ser usado para agendar uma tarefa para execução periódica.
No openEuler, o comando “cron” pode ser usado para agendar uma tarefa para execução periódica.

No modo normal do Vim no openEuler, colar conteúdo copiado com “yy” insere o conteúdo abaixo da linha atual.

For the C or C++ source code "c = a + b;", which of the following statements is true about the difference in assembly code between the Kunpeng processor and the x86 processor?

The Kunpeng processor uses two "ldr" instructions to load data, one "add" instruction for addition, and one "str" instruction to save the result. The x86 processor uses two "mov" instructions to load data, one "add" instruction for addition, and one "mov" instruction to save the result.
Both use two "mov" instructions to load data, one "add" instruction for addition, and one "mov" instruction to save the result.

The Kunpeng processor uses two "moy" instructions to load data, one "add" instruction for addition, and one "str" instruction to save the result. The x86 processor uses two "ldr" instructions to load data, one "add" instruction for addition, and one "mov" instruction to save the result. Both use two "ldr" instructions to load data, one "add" instruction for addition, and one "Str" instruction to save the result.
The Kunpeng processor uses "ldr" instructions to load data and "mov" to save results.
The x86 processor uses "moy" instructions to load data and "str" to save results.
Both processors use "add" instructions for addition and "str" to save results.
The Kunpeng processor uses "moy" to load data and "str" to save results, while x86 uses "ldr" and "mov".

The Kunpeng Porting Advisor encompasses multiple features to facilitate smooth application porting to Kunpeng processors. Among these features, which one provides not only in-depth static analysis of source code but also the ability to identify and resolve potential performance bottlenecks and compatibility issues stemming from fundamental differences in processor architectures?
Software package dependency analysis and replacement suggestions
Architecture adaptability analysis for source code, performance bottleneck identification, and optimization strategy provision
One-click conversion of software package formats and immediate execution support
System software inventory audit and porting guide

In this context, which of the following Statements IS the most inaccurate about the core objective of the post-porting performance testing or the characteristics of the tools and methods employed during its execution?

Advanced performance testing tools, such as LoadRunner, can simulate large-scale concurrent user activity to accurately evaluate the performance of ported software under high pressure on the Kunpeng architecture, thereby identifying potential bottlenecks
Post-porting performance testing focuses solely on verifying software functionality, ignoring performance metrics
Tools used in post-porting testing help identify stability and compatibility issues
Performance testing includes stress tests to evaluate system behavior under extreme conditions

Programs developed with compiled languages can be ported to Kunpeng processors without recompilation. However, if the programs rely on compiled libraries specific to a particular platform, these libraries need to be ported and recompiled.

In openGauss, the Sophon intelligent index optimization technology enables databases to adjust index policies based on workloads automatically. In this way, the query performance can be continuously optimized without manual intervention.

The Kunpeng community provides developers with a comprehensive support platform, including software porting guides, performance tuning tools, technical support, and open source collaboration opportunities. These resources empower developers to smoothly port and optimize existing applications on Kunpeng processor-based platforms and participate in the development of the Kunpeng ecosystem. However, all resources and services offered by the Kunpeng community are limited to software-level support and do not extend to hardware-level technical support.

In the "pg_hba.conf" file, each record occupies one row and specifies an authentication rule. An empty row or a row started with a number sign (#) is neglected.

No Linux, processos com maior prioridade são executados preferencialmente. Um valor PRI mais alto indica maior prioridade de processo.

After the openGauss enterprise edition is installed, you can run the "gs_om -t start" command to start the database.
In openEuler, the "at" command can be used to schedule a task for periodic execution.
In openEuler, the file permission string "rwxr-xr-x" represents three user roles: the file owner, the owner group, and other users.
In openEuler, the "ps -ef | grep xxx" command can be used to find processes that contain "xxx" within their process information.

The Kunpeng 920 processor features a powerful 64-core design and integrates eight advanced DDR4 memory controllers, enabling support for up to eight DDR4 memory slots to meet high-performance computing demands.

In openGauss, the Sophon intelligent index optimization technology enables databases to adjust index policies based on workloads automatically. In this way, the query performance can be continuously optimized without manual intervention.

The Kunpeng community provides developers with a comprehensive support platform, including software porting guides, performance tuning tools, technical support, and open source collaboration opportunities. These resources empower developers to smoothly port and optimize existing applications on Kunpeng processor-based platforms and participate in the development of the Kunpeng ecosystem, jointly driving technological advancements. However, all resources and services offered by the Kunpeng community are limited to software-level support and do not extend to hardware-level technical support.

The cluster manager (CM) manages and monitors the running status of each functional unit and physical resource in the openGauss database system, executes SQL commands sent by a client, and processes data storage and query tasks.

The openEuler kernel, derived from Linux, supports Kunpeng and various other processors, maximizing their computational potential. openEuler is a high-performance, stable, and secure open source OS built by a global community and suitable for databases, big data, cloud computing, and AI.

Which of the following support does Huawei provide for the Kunpeng computing industry?
Todos os itens (A, B, C e D) são suportes que a Huawei oferece para a indústria de computação Kunpeng.
Toolchains: Ferramentas de desenvolvimento de software otimizadas para a arquitetura Kunpeng, facilitando a criação de aplicativos e soluções.
Cloud services: Serviços em nuvem baseados na tecnologia Kunpeng, oferecendo infraestrutura, plataformas e software como serviço (IaaS, PaaS e SaaS).
Community services: Suporte e recursos para desenvolvedores, incluindo fóruns, documentação, exemplos de código e programas de parceria.
Professional services: Serviços de consultoria, implementação, suporte técnico e treinamento para empresas que utilizam a tecnologia Kunpeng.
Which of the following statements about the Huawei Kunpeng 920 CPU are true?
It supports the PCle 4.0 interface and is compatible with PCIe 3.0/2.0/1.0.
Which of the following descriptions about the Huawei Kunpeng 920 CPU accelerators are true?
Todas as descrições (A, B e C) são verdadeiras sobre os aceleradores da CPU Huawei Kunpeng 920.

Motor de aceleração SSL: A CPU possui um motor de aceleração SSL integrado, que permite realizar operações de criptografia SSL de forma mais rápida e eficiente, otimizando o desempenho de servidores web e aplicações que utilizam HTTPS.

Motor de aceleração de criptografia/descriptografia: A Kunpeng 920 possui um motor de aceleração dedicado para operações de criptografia e descriptografia, o que acelera o processamento de dados confidenciais e garante a segurança das informações.

Motor de aceleração de compressão/descompressão: A CPU também possui um motor de aceleração para compressão e descompressão de dados, o que melhora o desempenho de aplicações que trabalham com grandes volumes de dados, como servidores de arquivos e bancos de dados.
